title: Justicar zed

Yeh but it's a twist like how syndra is all evil but she has a justicar skin. Pretty much like a redeemed riven too i guess.

(( Redeemed Riven makes sense in her current lore. She fought for Noxus, found out what she was doing was wrong, and left the military. She is now trying to redeem herself. ))

(( Syndra isn't inherently evil, just obsessed with power. When she realized her mentor was holding her power back she killed him in order to gain more power. Justicar is to show what she could have been if she followed her Mentor's training. ))

(( Although not every skin is lore based, Justicar follows a champion's lore. Zed wouldn't really make much sense in this case because his lore doesn't fit like the others in the pattern in my opinion. ))
Who the hell told you skins have to be connected with lore? Is Cho'Gath from the British part of the Void? Are Nasus, Renekton, and Azir aliens? Is Lucian a soccer player?

> (( Although not every skin is lore based ... because his lore doesn't fit like the others in the pattern in my opinion )) 

I stated that not every skin is lore based and I'm okay with this, but because this line seems to follow lore and - again in my opinion, heaven forbid it's unpopular evidently - Zed doesn't seem to follow the same pattern as the others, I wouldn't want to see this. I'm not saying it's bad, I'm just saying I personally don't want it.

Aatrox has a Justicar skin, how does that fit into his lore? I don't see any way it could.

If we do go by what you say of them being lore-based though, Zed's Justicar could represent maybe if he wouldn't have looked into the box and not have destroyed their old ninja order.

And that's a fair point, however I don't see it like that. Why don't I see it like that? Because Zed's abilities come from training, not from the refinement of his abilities like with Syndra. I believe that if he hadn't looked into the box that he wouldn't even have his abilities and he'd be more like Shen with his fighting style, but with a more offensive set of abilities due to their personalities.

As for Aatrox, it's in my opinion that since he's a conflicting character. One on hand, he helps people win wars throughout history. On the other hand, HE HELPS PEOPLE WIN WARS THROUGHOUT HISTORY. I believe that Justicar Aatrox shows a part of him as more of a defender of the weak, rather than someone who can turn several men into bloodthirsty savages. He's someone who uses war to end war, rather than continuing it. Maybe that doesn't make sense, but it's just my opinion on how it's the same Aatrox using his abilities for the greater good in my opinion.

TL;DR It's really just my opinion and I don't like it. Nothing wrong with that, just like there's nothing wrong with yours. :) < Agree to disagree even if I look silly with my opinion?

Um, seeing some of these comments make me wonder if people are aware Aatrox also has this skin (butthurt Aatrox main here)
Anyway, I think this would be a cool skin for Zed, as the Justicar skin fits in with his personal details and lore.
Syndra is this all powerful Mage who just wrecks everything. Her power is almost godly so the Justicar skin represents her as an almost ascended being. 
Aatrox travels through time and appears at various points changing the course of wars and fights, making losing fights turn around and cause people to turn savage and lose all fear. His Justicar skin is possibly how the humans see him based on the stories and the legends, seeing him as a God who brought them hope in the darkest of times, although at a second glance we see that the fighters did terrible things due to Aatrox's influence.

For Zed, this can be his God-like status after delving into the darkest of arts. These arts taught him true power and thus earning him a place in the Justicar skin set.

None of the champs are aligned with factions. They do what they want, when they want, no shits given.

Make this skin happen, Rito!
